text: Ah, that chick. I was playing it with my cat nearby, every time that thing peeped, my cat would look around like "The hell was that?"

text:
This theme reminds me of how relaxing of an experience this game was...
until the ending boss fight/marathon where I died like 90 times because of the time limit of the first 3 stages...

text: Man, Minish Cap is so underrated. I wish they brought back the mole gloves in a newer Zelda game.

text: This is like one of my top favorite Zelda games, it's so good!
author: Niclas

text: I was wondering when this would make it into your list!  Minish Cap is such an underappreciated gem.  It came out at a really unfortunate time.

text: why do you say that? was there another big release or was it just late in the GBA era?

text: It came out when the DS had been out for a couple of months (in NA at least).
author: totlyepic

text: My favorite top down Zelda, easily. It may be "objectively" worse than others but I spent a lot of time having fun with it.
author: Alon Jacovi

text: Oh man, if the map was bigger it'd have been amazing. I loved all the tiny secrets to explore- I just wish there would have been more.
author: Denied1213

text: How does the gameplay style of this game relate to others in the series, thinkin' of getting this on the VC when it comes out?
author: Sharpie473

text: It's just like any other 2D Zelda game... except Zelda II, naturally.
author: Hawlo

text: Feels a lot like the Oracle games (which Capcom also did).  It's not too difficult, but it has some fun dungeons/fights.  It also does the sword arts (or whatever they termed them as) thing that Twilight Princess later copied (I guess Wind Waker sort of did it too, but to a much lesser degree).
author: totlyepic

text: @totlyepic Sounds like a fun and challenging game.
author: Sharpie473

text: It's my favorite handheld Zelda.
author: Dessa

text: Au mon Dieu cette musique !!!!!! Tellement de souvenir ^^
author: Lenster

text: The Dynasty Warriors series never really got my attention, but it certainly does now with its upcoming spinoff Hyrule Warriors. I honestly don't have high expectations, but it could be refreshingly entertaining. If there's one 3rd company that knew how to make great Zelda games, it's Capcom. The Oracle games and Minish Cap were absolutely solid. I wouldn't mind Nintendo giving them the chance to make another portable game in the series.
author: SupraDarky

text:
@SupraDarky 
I totally agree! The Capcom Zeldas were my favorite 2D Zelda games by far!
author: Just Ryan

text:
@Mahdino
Very.
author: SupraDarky

text: @SupraDarky I have high hopes for hyrule warriors, dynasty warriors is best when attached to an existing franchise. I enjoy the dynasty warrior gundam games more than the regular dynasty warriors games because I enjoy the gundam universe and it lets me play as any character I could ever possibly want to play. Hyrule warriors looks like it's going to have an insane amount of playable characters and that makes me happy.
author: 0c0rena

text:
Minish Cap is my all-time favorite out of all of the handheld LoZ games.

Not even out of nostalgia- I played Link to the Past first.
author: Denied1213

text: @0c0rena I couldn't agree more about your statement! I've enjoyed the Dynasty Warrior Gundam and One Piece: Pirate Warriors games simply because there's nothing better then playing as some of your favorite characters from the series you love. ﻿

text: @Denied1213 Link to the Past was for SNES... Unless you mean the GBA port?
